section.name: name
section.description: nw - a network management service

section.name: synopsis
section.description: nw <command>

section.name: description
section.description: The "nw" CLI allows you to manage networks. The service can perform allocation, and listing of currently allocated CIDR ranges and guarantees that allocated CIDR ranges do not overlap to help avoid conflicts. Note that the CLI returns an empty result if an operation could not be performed.

section.name: examples
section.description: N/A

command.name: ls
command.description: The "ls" command allows you to list information about CIDR ranges.

command.name: group
command.description: The "group" command allows you to work with logical groups of CIDR ranges.

command.name: allocate
command.description: The "allocate" command allows you reserve a deconflicted CIDR range.

command.name: deallocate
command.description: The "deallocate" command allows you to deallocate an allocated CIDR range, restoring the range to the free pool.

section.name: name
section.description: ls - list information about CIDR ranges.

section.name: synopsis
section.description: nw ls <command>

section.name: description
section.description: The "ls" command allows you to peek at allocated or free CIDR ranges.

option.name: -fp
option.description: Lists free CIDR ranges with a given prefix.

section.name: name
section.description: group - work with logical CIDR range groups.

section.name: synopsis
section.description: nw group <command>

section.name: description
section.description: The "group" command allows you to work with logical groups of CIDR ranges.

command.name: create
command.description: Allows you to create a new logical group of managed CIDR ranges.

command.name: mv
command.description: Allows you to rename a new logical group.

command.name: rm
command.description: Allows you to remove a logical group.

command.name: ls
command.description: Allows you to list logical group names.

section.name: name
section.description: create - create a new logical CIDR range group.

section.name: synopsis
section.description: nw group create 'groupname'

section.name: description
section.description: The "create" command allows you to create a new, uniquely named, logical group of allocatable CIDR ranges.

section.name: name
section.description: mv - rename a logical group.

section.name: synopsis
section.description: nw group mv 'oldname' 'newname'

section.name: description
section.description: The "mv" command renames an existing logical group of allocatable CIDR ranges.

section.name: name
section.description: rm - remove a logical group.

section.name: synopsis
section.description: nw group rm 'groupname'

section.name: description
section.description: The "rm" command removes an existing logical group of allocatable CIDR ranges.

section.name: name
section.description: ls - list logical group names.

section.name: synopsis
section.description: nw group ls

section.name: description
section.description: The "ls" command allows you to list all the named logical group of allocatable CIDR ranges.

section.name: name
section.description: nw allocate - reserve a CIDR range.

section.name: synopsis
section.description: nw allocate [-g | -fg] 'groupname' (-p 'CIDR prefix' | -n 'ip/prefix')

section.name: description
section.description: The "allocate" command allows you to reserve a free CIDR range in a logical pool.

option.name: -g
option.description: name a logical pool to allocate a CIDR range against.

option.name: -p
option.description: allocate a semi-random CIDR range with a given prefix.

option.name: -n
option.description: allocate a specific provided CIDR range with a given prefix.

option.name: -fg
option.description: add a specific provided CIDR range to the free pool of allocatable CIDR ranges.

section.name: name
section.description: nw deallocate - deallocate a reserved CIDR range, restoring it to the free pool.

section.name: synopsis
section.description: nw deallocate -g 'groupname' -n 'ip/prefix')

section.name: description
section.description: The "deallocate" command allows you to deallocate reserved CIDR range. The ip and prefix must match an allocated range exactly.

option.name: -g
option.description: name a logical pool to deallocate a CIDR range from.

option.name: -n
option.description: deallocate a specific provided CIDR range with a given prefix.

option.name: -fg
option.description: remove a specific provided CIDR range from the free pool of allocatable CIDR ranges.
